thread.title: Update: Suspected Folsom burglar crashes into mini-van with mom, child
thread.title_full: Update: Suspected Folsom burglar crashes into mini-van with mom, child

author:

title: Update: Suspected Folsom burglar crashes into mini-van with mom, child
text:
October 26, 2015 Update: Suspected Folsom burglar crashes into mini-van with mom, child 
After a three-mile chase, the car collided with a mini-van at Blue Ravine and Big Valley roads 
Covering crime, police and courts in the Sacramento region Map locates the approximate location of the burglary and the accident. googlemaps.com i 
blindelof@sacbee.com 
A fleeing motorist suspected in a burglary crashed Monday morning, injuring a woman, police said. 
The collision occurred after a burglary in the 300 block of East Bidwell St. Folsom police spokesman Sgt. Andrew Bates said that the police received a call a little after 8 a.m. Monday from a business owner reporting a break-in. Later, it was learned that a burglar had opened a hole in a wall separating a hair salon from a skateboard shop. 
When officers arrived on the scene, they discovered that the burglar had just left the scene in a car. Officers spotted the car and tried to stop it, but the driver sped away, pursued by police. 
After a three-mile chase, the car collided with a mini-van at the Blue Ravine and Big Valley roads intersection. Inside the mini-van was a mother with her small child. 
The child was not hurt, but the mother suffered minor injury from the activation of the vehicle air safety bag. The suspected burglar, who is 25 years old, also had minor injuries. 
The identity of the suspected burglar, who had a warrant for his arrest for an unrelated burglary, was not immediately released.
